{{Infobox Embedded System |image1 = <!-- Image filename --> |image1_size = <!-- Image size, ex.150px --> |caption = Wireless-N ADSL2+/Fibre Broadband Router |caption2 = <!-- 2nd tagleine --> |pp = <!-- product page url only --> |sp = <!-- Support page url only --> |dl = <!-- Download page url only --> |wikidevi = Billion_BiPAC_7800VNOX |wikipedia = <!-- [[wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]] Leave blank for none --> |ddwrtsupport = <!-- Activation, Donation, Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, TBD, Unofficially, WIP --> |openwrtsupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |tomatosupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, --> |gargoylesupport = <!-- Incompatible, Not Supported, Partial Support, Supported, WIP, Unofficially, -->
|brand = Billion |model = BiPAC 7800VNOX |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = <!-- Model Revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = N300 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router,dsl modem,analog phone gateway |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = QI3BIL-7800VNOX |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM6361; |cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = MIPS32 |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --><!-- MIPS32 Big Endian --> |cpu1spd = 400 <!-- 400 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L12835EMI-10G; |flash1size = 16 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 256 |ram1chip = Samsung;K4T1G084QF-BCF7; |ram1_num = 2 |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |sw1chip = Broadcom;BCM53125; |dsl_ports = |voip_ports = |wan_ports = <!-- 1 --> |wan_speed = <!-- 10MbE,100MbE,1GbE, --> |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 1GbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = ADSL2+ |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.1.254 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = wlan-ap |defaultssid_regex = ^wlan-ap$ |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = <!-- Manufacturer --> |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = <!-- Yes, or No, --> |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 04/25/2013 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = Taiwan
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL,RP-SMA |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = <!-- core revision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== Per the FCC internal photos, this device uses the following... *ADSL+WiSoC: BCM6361KFEBG **+ BCM6302KMLG Line Driver ? *GbE Switch: BCM53125SKMMLG *2x [http://www.zarlink.com/zarlink/VE890_product_preview_sept09.pdf '''Zarlink''' / '''Legerity''' Le89316QVC (Le89316) + Le89810BSC (Le89810)] (VoIP, 2x FXS + 1x FXO), omitted on some models? .. a '''Samsung''' K9F4G08U0D-SCB0 NAND Flash (4Gb / 512MB) is also shown on the board, but it seems that it may not actually be used on any models covered by this FCC ID.. hmm..
.. this device may share the same board as the [[Billion BiPAC 7800VDPX]]. There is space (unpopulated) for a 5GHz radio on the board.
The FCC test report states that the data is applicable to the...<small> *'''BEC''' 7800VNOX **Detachable antenna, grey upper + silver lower casing, no NAND *'''BEC''' 7800VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN *'''BEC''' 7801VNP **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO, no USB *'''BEC''' 7801VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO *'''BEC''' 6800VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, no DSL *'''BEC''' 6800VNP **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, no DSL, no USB *'''BEC''' 6801VNPX **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO, no DSL *'''BEC''' 6801VNP **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, 1 port FXS+FXO, no DSL, no USB *'''BEC''' 7800NX **Detachable antenna, gray upper + silver lower casing, no NAND, no VoIP *'''BEC''' 7800NXL **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no VPN, no VoIP *'''BEC''' 7800N ''R2'' **Detachable antenna, blue upper + white lower casing, no NAND, no USB, no VoIP</small> ... but look at the tables in the test report for a better comparison of the units, assuming any of this is even accurate..
Default settings are per the FCC manual.
The manual specifies three login credentials for the device.. *'''Administrator:''' admin/admin *'''Local:''' user/user *'''Remote:''' support/support
[[Category:English Documentation]]
